channel.title: [pi]help please![pi]
channel.description:
Hello Moparscape:).
I've recently created a custom mini-game called 'Dead vs Undead'.
When the Dead vs Undead game ends, they get teleported home and get 35 Ecto-tokens.
PROBLEM! When a player is in the Dead vs Undead arena, and they log off the server. When they log back into the server, they appear home and still get the 35 Ecto-tokens.
I've had to remove the portal to the mini-game until I can fix it so when they log off and log back in, they appear home but DO NOT get the 35 Ecto-tokens.
I'm guessing I've got to create a void, and declare it in there.. This is what I have so far -
[code]public void endGame() {
getItems().deleteAllItems(); getItems().addItem(4278, 35); getPA().movePlayer(3093, 3493, 0); }[/code]
Which deletes all items upon the game ending, then gives them 35 Ecto tokens and teleports them home.
Anyone know how to stop it giving the tokens after re-logging while in the mini-game.
Thanks, AnonymousZ.

item.title: [pi]help please![pi]
item.dc:creator: @Brandontan Brandontan
item.description:
@Brandontan wrote:

or have an if statement that says something like
if(logout == true && inectoarena == true)
ectotoken -= 35

Read full topic

item.title: [pi]help please![pi]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Under
public void logout() {
You could make a if statement checking if their in the area, and if they are then teleport them to home, or don’t let them logout by sendMesssage.

Read full topic

item.title: [pi]help please![pi]
item.dc:creator: @AnonymousZ AnonymousZ
item.description:
@AnonymousZ wrote:

Hello Moparscape:).

I’ve recently created a custom mini-game called ‘Dead vs Undead’.

When the Dead vs Undead game ends, they get teleported home and get 35 Ecto-tokens.

PROBLEM!
When a player is in the Dead vs Undead arena, and they log off the server. When they log back into the server, they appear home and still get the 35 Ecto-tokens.

I’ve had to remove the portal to the mini-game until I can fix it so when they log off and log back in, they appear home but DO NOT get the 35 Ecto-tokens.

I’m guessing I’ve got to create a void, and declare it in there…
This is what I have so far -

[code]public void endGame() {

getItems().deleteAllItems();
getItems().addItem(4278, 35);
getPA().movePlayer(3093, 3493, 0);

}[/code]

Which deletes all items upon the game ending, then gives them 35 Ecto tokens and teleports them home.

Anyone know how to stop it giving the tokens after re-logging while in the mini-game.

Thanks,
AnonymousZ.

Read full topic
